page.title: 01SPROTBROUGH AND CUSWORTH
page.content: The area is 60 % Rural in character. The remainder being taken up by the grounds of an Historic House and residential areas. The area is bisected by the A1 Motorway - thus the rural is separated from the residential.The A1M is known as the Doncaster By-Pass. There are four Primary Schools, one Secondary School and one College used for Higher Education. The major land useage in the rural section is that of Farmland producing crops such as wheat,barley, peas, rape and sugar beet. There is a small area which is used for grazing. The Historic House,Cusworth Hall, is used as a Museum exhibiting items of local interest.Within its grounds is a Cricket Ground and Fishing Ponds. Most people work in offices,shops, manufacturing industries and mining.
